contextDocDescription: Pedagogical guide used as context when generating lessons. Edit to customize.
prerequisiteDescription: Optional diagnostic to check your prerequisite knowledge before starting.
courseStructureDescription: Lessons are organized as a dependency graph. Click a lesson to view its content. Lessons in the same row can be studied in parallel.
blockedByFailedLesson: {{count}} lesson(s) scored below {{threshold}}%. All lessons must pass.
passThresholdNote: Minimum weighted score required to pass the course.
noLessonCanFailNote: When enabled, every lesson must score above the failure threshold.
lessonFailureThresholdNote: Minimum score each lesson must achieve when no-lesson-can-fail is on.
weightedScoreTooltip: Each lesson's best quiz score is multiplied by its weight, then all products are summed and divided by the total weight. The result must reach the pass threshold to complete the course.
contextDocGuideP1: Every course has a Context Document — a pedagogical guide that shapes how each lesson is generated.
contextDocGuideP2: It defines notation conventions, teaching approach, key themes, difficulty calibration, and explanation style. The AI follows these guidelines when creating every lesson.
contextDocGuideP3: You can edit this document to match your preferences — for example, change the formality level, request more visual examples, or adjust the notation style. Your changes will influence all future lesson generations.
contextDocGuideCta: Scroll down to the Context Document card to review and customize it.
